result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven J Wukoman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

charges.descr: Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample, pay related surcharge.
Defendant to  pay a $1,500.00 surcharge for pornographic images.  DOC to take up to 25% of prison funds.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Court costs and victim witness surcharges, DNA surcharge   to be paid by 4/4/2022.  DOC is to take up to 25% of prison funds.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
No unsupervised contact with anyone under the age of 18.   Court advised the defendant of penalties if this order is violated.
No use of computer or internet without the agents approval.

Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications.
Sex offender evaluation and any recommended treatment.
Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification course.
Defendant to register with the Sex Offender Registry.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.

supervisions.notes: Defendant advised that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms.  Court advised defendant that his civil rights are restored.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Steven J Wukoman in court with attorney Jason David Luczak.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 6 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 3 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 5 days. Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 4/4/2022, DOC is to take up to 25% of prison funds; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 4/4/2022, DOC is to take up to 25% of prison funds;; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Restitution is set at zero 
-Defendant to pay a $1500.00 surcharge for pornographic images, DOC is to take up to 25% of prison funds;; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any couseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications
-Sex offender evaluation and any recommended treatment
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification course
-No unsupervised contact  with anyone under the age of 18. Court advised the defendant of the penalties if this order is violated.
-No use of computer or internet without the agents approval
-Defendant to register with the Sex Offender Registry
Defendant advised that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
SENTENCING MEMORANDUM from Attorney Jason D. Luczak, received and filed. lms

Defendant Steven J Wukoman in court with attorney Jason David Luczak and attorney D Michael Guerin.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM  
As to Count 2
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
As to Counts 1, 3, 4 are dismissed but read-in.
Court amends the Information of the address in the information to 5999 W Burnham St, West Allis, WI.  Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 15.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Steven J Wukoman in court with Attorneys D. Michael Guerin and Jason David Luczak.  
Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Motion Hearing and Final Pretrial.  Copy of Decision and Order signed by the court provided to counsels.  Hearing proceeded.  The Court has issued a written decision as to defense motion regarding WI Stat. 939.617.  The Court finds that the statue does require a mandatory minimum sentence; reasons set for in the written decision.  Therefore, the Court denies defense motion arguing against mandatory minimum.  Defense withdraws suppression motion at this time.  The Court holds colloquy with defendant as to withdrawal; defendant concurs with withdrawal.  Parties engaged in negotiations; defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.  At the request of the parties, the Court VACATES Jury Trial date of 2-29-16.  JusticePoint miss addressed with the parties.  The state is not seeking any action, the Court takes no action as to miss.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 9, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Decision and Order signed and filed.  Copy to the state and defense in open court.
JusticePoint Pretrial Report, received and filed.
DEFENDANT'S REPLY BRIEF REGARDING HIS MOTION FOR THECOURT TO DETERMINE WHETHER WISCONSIN STATUE SEC. 939.617 REQUIRES MINIMUM PERIOD OF INCARCERATION.

Defendant Steven J Wukoman in court with Attorney Jason David Luczak.  
Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD; BRANCH 15 IN TRIAL.  
Matter before the Court for Motion Hearing.  Parties informed that Branch 15 is in jury trial and unable to hear this matter on today.  Defense requests adjournment instead of spin court.  Due to the expected length of motion hearing (2 pending motions) the court will not spin this matter; request for adjournment granted.  Final pretrial set for 2-11-16 removed from the calendar at this time;  final pretrial to conducted on motion date.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 18, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Motion hearing scheduled for February 18, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Report, received and filed.

Defendant Steven J Wukoman in court with attorney D Michael Guerin.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
One of the State's witnesses is unavailable for the trial dates. Court grants State's motion to adjourn. Case rescheduled for MOTION HEARING, FINAL PRETRIAL and JURY TRIAL in Branch 15. Pretrial Scheduling Order signed and filed.  Motion hearing scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 09:00 am.
